trans-unit.source: Gets the data execution prevention (DEP) policy setting for the system

seg-source.mrk: Gets the data execution prevention (DEP) policy setting for the system

target.mrk: Gets the data execution prevention (DEP) policy setting for the system

trans-unit.source: Return Value
Returns The DEP policy setting, which can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: Returns The DEP policy setting, which can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: Returns The DEP policy setting, which can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: 0 - AlwaysOff
DEP is disabled for all parts of the system, regardless of hardware support for DEP. The processor

seg-source.mrk: DEP is disabled for all parts of the system, regardless of hardware support for DEP.

target.mrk: DEP is disabled for all parts of the system, regardless of hardware support for DEP.

trans-unit.source: runs in PAE mode with 32-bit versions of Windows unless PAE is disabled in the boot configuration data.

seg-source.mrk: runs in PAE mode with 32-bit versions of Windows unless PAE is disabled in the boot configuration data.

target.mrk: runs in PAE mode with 32-bit versions of Windows unless PAE is disabled in the boot configuration data.

trans-unit.source: 1 - AlwaysOn
DEP is enabled for all parts of the system. All processes always run with DEP enabled. DEP cannot

seg-source.mrk: DEP is enabled for all parts of the system.
All processes always run with DEP enabled.

target.mrk: DEP is enabled for all parts of the system.
All processes always run with DEP enabled.

trans-unit.source: be explicitly disabled for selected applications. System compatibility fixes are ignored.

seg-source.mrk: be explicitly disabled for selected applications.

target.mrk: be explicitly disabled for selected applications.

trans-unit.source: 2 - OptIn
On systems with processors that are capable of hardware-enforced DEP, DEP is automatically enabled

seg-source.mrk: On systems with processors that are capable of hardware-enforced DEP, DEP is automatically enabled

target.mrk: On systems with processors that are capable of hardware-enforced DEP, DEP is automatically enabled

trans-unit.source: only for operating system components. This is the default setting for client versions of Windows.

seg-source.mrk: This is the default setting for client versions of Windows.

target.mrk: This is the default setting for client versions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: DEP can be explicitly enabled for selected applications or the current process.

seg-source.mrk: DEP can be explicitly enabled for selected applications or the current process.

target.mrk: DEP can be explicitly enabled for selected applications or the current process.

trans-unit.source: 3 - OptOut
DEP is automatically enabled for operating system components and all processes. This is the default

seg-source.mrk: DEP is automatically enabled for operating system components and all processes.

target.mrk: DEP is automatically enabled for operating system components and all processes.

trans-unit.source: setting for Windows Server versions. DEP can be explicitly disabled for selected applications or

seg-source.mrk: DEP can be explicitly disabled for selected applications or

target.mrk: DEP can be explicitly disabled for selected applications or

trans-unit.source: the current process. System compatibility fixes for DEP are in effect.

seg-source.mrk: System compatibility fixes for DEP are in effect.

target.mrk: System compatibility fixes for DEP are in effect.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
This function requires Windows XP with SP3, Windows Vista with SP1 or later.

seg-source.mrk: This function requires Windows XP with SP3, Windows Vista with SP1 or later.

target.mrk: This function requires Windows XP with SP3, Windows Vista with SP1 or later.

trans-unit.source: See Also
Search GetSystemDEPPolicy in MSDN Library.
